_meta.description: Extended interpretation data for Blueprint (premium) tier. Supplements the core interpretation_matrix.json.

partnership_compatibility._note: Maps each Life Path to ideal partner/collaborator types by business role. Used in Chapter 9 of the Blueprint report.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 leads, 2 mediates and handles relationships, 6 builds team loyalty. 1 needs a partner who won't compete for the spotlight but will manage the people side.

ideal_ops.why: 4 builds the systems 1 doesn't have patience for. 8 matches ambition and adds financial structure.

ideal_creative.why: 3 amplifies the message, 5 brings adaptability and market awareness.

friction_types.why: Two 1s create power struggles. 7s move too slowly and question too much for 1's pace.

ideal_mentor.why: 8 has walked the empire-building path. 22 provides institutional vision.

ideal_cofounder.why: 2 needs a decisive leader at the front. 1 or 8 provides the directional force while 2 manages harmony and partnerships.

ideal_ops.why: 4 creates structure 2 appreciates. 6 shares the people-first value system.

ideal_creative.why: 3 brings expressive energy 2 supports. 9 shares humanitarian vision.

friction_types.why: 5 is too unpredictable for 2's need for stability. 7 is too withdrawn for 2's partnership orientation.

ideal_mentor.why: 6 models service leadership. 11 provides the visionary inspiration 2 craves.

ideal_cofounder.why: 3 creates, 4 systematizes. 3 inspires, 8 monetizes. These are the most productive creative-business partnerships.

ideal_ops.why: 4 handles the structure 3 avoids. 2 manages relationships 3 starts but doesn't maintain.

ideal_creative.why: 5 matches creative energy with market adaptability. 9 adds depth and global perspective.

friction_types.why: Two 3s scatter in different creative directions. 7 is too analytical and slow for 3's pace.

ideal_mentor.why: 8 teaches monetization discipline. 1 models focused execution.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 provides vision and initiative 4 can build upon. 3 provides creative energy and market presence.

ideal_ops.why: Another 4 doubles systematic capacity. 2 adds diplomatic people skills.

ideal_creative.why: 3 brings creative spark 4 lacks. 5 introduces adaptability to 4's rigidity.

friction_types.why: 5 is too chaotic for 4's need for order. 3 may resent 4's constraints on creativity.

ideal_mentor.why: 22 is the master builder 4 aspires to be. 8 shows how systems create wealth.

ideal_cofounder.why: 4 grounds 5's restlessness. 8 channels 5's energy toward wealth building.

ideal_ops.why: 4 creates the stability 5 needs underneath. 6 maintains team and customer relationships.

ideal_creative.why: 3 matches creative energy. 1 provides focus and decisiveness.

friction_types.why: Two 5s create maximum chaos. 2 is too slow and cautious for 5's pace.

ideal_mentor.why: 7 teaches 5 the value of depth. 8 shows how to channel freedom into wealth.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 provides drive 6 channels into service. 8 adds financial ambition to 6's care-oriented approach.

ideal_ops.why: 4 builds systems 6 oversees with care. 2 shares relational values.

ideal_creative.why: 3 adds expressive energy. 9 shares the service-first mission.

friction_types.why: 5 is too unstable for 6's need for family-like security. 7 is too detached for 6's warmth.

ideal_mentor.why: 9 models service at global scale. 33 embodies the master teacher.

ideal_cofounder.why: 3 communicates what 7 discovers. 8 monetizes 7's knowledge. These partnerships turn expertise into empires.

ideal_ops.why: 4 handles operational detail. 2 manages the relationships 7 avoids.

ideal_creative.why: 3 translates 7's depth into accessible content. 5 brings market energy.

friction_types.why: 1 moves too fast without enough analysis. 5 is too scattered for 7's focus.

ideal_mentor.why: 11 matches 7's intuitive depth with vision. 9 expands 7's often narrow focus.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 matches 8's drive with initiative. 7 provides the deep expertise that gives 8 businesses a moat.

ideal_ops.why: 4 builds the infrastructure 8 designs. 6 creates the culture that retains talent.

ideal_creative.why: 3 adds personality to 8's brands. 5 brings market adaptability.

friction_types.why: Two 8s create power conflicts. 9 may resist 8's material focus.

ideal_mentor.why: 22 models institutional scale. 1 reminds 8 that it starts with individual vision.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 provides practical initiative for 9's vision. 8 adds the financial structure humanitarian ventures need.

ideal_ops.why: 4 creates organizational backbone. 6 shares service orientation.

friction_types.why: 5 lacks 9's commitment to cause. 8 may push too hard on profit over purpose.

ideal_mentor.why: 11 shares visionary capacity. 33 models service at the highest level.

ideal_cofounder.why: 4 grounds 11's visionary energy. 8 builds the empire around 11's vision.

ideal_ops.why: 4 handles systems. 2 manages the sensitive interpersonal dynamics 11 creates.

ideal_creative.why: 3 translates 11's downloads into content. 9 adds humanitarian depth.

friction_types.why: 1 is too self-focused for 11's collaborative vision. 5 is too scattered for 11's intensity.

ideal_mentor.why: 22 shows how to build from vision. 33 models the master teacher path.

ideal_cofounder.why: 1 provides initiative. 11 shares visionary capacity but adds intuitive dimension.

ideal_ops.why: 4 and 8 are the only numbers that can match 22's building capacity.

ideal_creative.why: 3 communicates 22's complex vision. 9 adds global scope.

friction_types.why: 5 and 3 are too scattered for 22's institutional focus.

ideal_mentor.why: 8 models material mastery. 33 models spiritual mastery. 22 needs both.

ideal_cofounder.why: 4 creates structure for 33's teachings. 8 ensures financial sustainability of the mission.

ideal_ops.why: 4 handles practical systems. 6 shares service values.

ideal_creative.why: 3 amplifies the message. 11 adds visionary partnership.

friction_types.why: 1 may prioritize self over service. 8 may push profit over purpose.

ideal_mentor.why: 9 models humanitarian service. 22 models institutional building.

action_plan_archetypes._note: Maps dominant energy combinations to 90-day phase structures. Look up by Life Path for primary structure, modify by Expression for execution style.

analyst_builder.applies_to: LP7 + Expr8, LP7 + Expr4, LP4 + Expr8
analyst_builder.phase_1_focus: Research and validate. Spend days 1-30 deep-diving into one opportunity. Interview 5 potential customers or collaborators. Build your conviction through evidence, not excitement.
analyst_builder.phase_1_avoid: Starting to build anything. You will be tempted to skip validation and go straight to construction. Resist.
analyst_builder.phase_2_focus: Build the system. Days 31-60 are for creating the minimum viable version of whatever you validated. One product, one offer, one system. Your 4/8 energy wants to build it right — let it, but set a hard deadline.
analyst_builder.phase_2_avoid: Perfectionism. Your system does not need to be beautiful. It needs to work. Ship at 80%.
analyst_builder.phase_3_focus: Launch and measure. Days 61-90: put it in front of real humans. Your 7 will want to retreat to analysis. Your 8 needs to see revenue. Set a specific financial target and drive toward it.
analyst_builder.phase_3_avoid: Starting something new. The temptation will be strongest here. New ideas are procrastination in disguise.
permission_slips: Permission to launch before it's perfect.
Permission to charge premium prices for your expertise.
Permission to ignore new ideas for 90 days.

visionary_communicator.applies_to: LP3 + Expr8, LP1 + Expr3, LP3 + Expr1, LP9 + Expr3
visionary_communicator.phase_1_focus: Choose ONE message. Days 1-30: distill your vision into a single, clear value proposition. Test it in content — 30 pieces in 30 days. See what resonates.
visionary_communicator.phase_1_avoid: Building a product before you have an audience response. Your creative energy wants to make things. Channel it into content first.
visionary_communicator.phase_2_focus: Build the audience engine. Days 31-60: double down on what worked in Phase 1. Create a simple opt-in or list. Start conversations with your most engaged followers.
visionary_communicator.phase_2_avoid: Trying to monetize too early. Trust the process — audience first, product second.
visionary_communicator.phase_3_focus: Make the first offer. Days 61-90: create a minimum viable offer based on what your audience has told you they need. Launch it to your list. Learn from the response.
visionary_communicator.phase_3_avoid: Over-engineering the product. Your first offer should take less than a week to create.
permission_slips: Permission to be imperfect in public.
Permission to sell before you feel ready.
Permission to focus on one platform only.

intuitive_strategist.applies_to: LP7 + Pisces, LP7 + Scorpio, LP11 + any, LP9 + Expr7
intuitive_strategist.phase_1_focus: Listen and synthesize. Days 1-30: consume deeply in your niche. Read, watch, interview. Let your intuition process patterns. Journal daily — your best insights come through writing.
intuitive_strategist.phase_1_avoid: Forcing conclusions. Your intuition needs time. Don't rush to a plan until the vision crystallizes.
intuitive_strategist.phase_2_focus: Map the strategy. Days 31-60: translate your intuitive downloads into a concrete plan. One page. Three priorities. Five milestones. Your 7 energy loves this phase — let it structure the insight.
intuitive_strategist.phase_2_avoid: Staying in strategy mode indefinitely. Set a hard date for when planning ends and action begins.
intuitive_strategist.phase_3_focus: Execute with trust. Days 61-90: follow the plan even when doubt creeps in. Your Pisces/intuitive energy will second-guess under pressure. Trust the work you did in Phases 1-2.
intuitive_strategist.phase_3_avoid: Isolation. This is when you need external accountability most. Weekly check-ins with a partner or coach.
permission_slips: Permission to trust your gut even when data is ambiguous.
Permission to ask for help during execution.

driven_executor.applies_to: LP1 + Expr8, LP8 + Expr1, LP8 + Expr8, LP1 + Horse, LP8 + Horse
driven_executor.phase_1_focus: Decide and commit. Days 1-30: pick the highest-leverage opportunity and go all in. You don't need more research — you need a decision. Make it in 72 hours, then spend the rest of the month building foundation.
driven_executor.phase_1_avoid: Keeping options open. Your power comes from focus. Close every door except one.
driven_executor.phase_2_focus: Scale the beachhead. Days 31-60: whatever worked in Phase 1, do more of it. Hire or delegate the tasks that slow you down. Your 8 energy needs leverage — create it.
driven_executor.phase_2_avoid: Doing everything yourself. Your bottleneck is you. Fix that now.
driven_executor.phase_3_focus: Systematize and expand. Days 61-90: build the systems that let growth continue without your daily involvement. Document processes. Train people. Your 8 energy builds empires — but only if you stop being the sole operator.
driven_executor.phase_3_avoid: Burnout-as-badge-of-honor. You will push too hard. Schedule recovery before you need it.
permission_slips: Permission to rest without losing momentum.
Permission to say no to everything that isn't your main focus.

adaptive_builder.applies_to: LP5 + any, LP3 + Expr5, LP5 + Expr3, Any + Gemini, Any + Sagittarius
adaptive_builder.phase_1_focus: Test fast. Days 1-30: run 3-5 small experiments. Different offers, different messages, different audiences. Your 5 energy excels at rapid iteration — use it strategically instead of chaotically.
adaptive_builder.phase_1_avoid: Committing to anything permanently. This phase is for data gathering, not marriage.
adaptive_builder.phase_2_focus: Double down on the winner. Days 31-60: pick the experiment that showed the most promise and go deep. This is the hardest phase for you — depth feels like a cage. It's actually a launchpad.
adaptive_builder.phase_2_avoid: Starting new experiments. The data is in. Trust it.
adaptive_builder.phase_3_focus: Build the first system. Days 61-90: take what's working and create a repeatable process. This is not natural for you — get a 4-energy partner or use templates.
adaptive_builder.phase_3_avoid: Pivoting. If you pivot now, you restart the entire cycle. Commit through discomfort.
permission_slips: Permission to be bored and keep going anyway.
Permission to build one thing instead of five.
Permission to ask structured thinkers for help.

service_leader.applies_to: LP6 + any, LP2 + Expr6, LP9 + Expr6, Any + Cancer
service_leader.phase_1_focus: Define your service boundary. Days 1-30: get clear on WHO you serve and HOW — with a scope limit. Your 6 energy will try to help everyone. Narrowing feels wrong but unlocks growth.
service_leader.phase_1_avoid: Saying yes to every request. Practice the sentence: 'That's not my focus right now.'
service_leader.phase_2_focus: Package your care. Days 31-60: turn your natural service into a structured offering with clear pricing. You chronically undercharge — price 20% higher than feels comfortable.
service_leader.phase_2_avoid: Giving it away for free because someone 'needs' it. Value exchange matters.
service_leader.phase_3_focus: Build referral systems. Days 61-90: your loyal community IS your growth engine. Create a simple referral mechanism and ask your best clients to share.
service_leader.phase_3_avoid: Aggressive marketing that feels inauthentic. Your growth comes from depth of relationship, not breadth of reach.
permission_slips: Permission to charge what you're worth.
Permission to say no to people who drain you.
Permission to put your business needs alongside others' needs.

1.energy: New beginnings, independence, initiative. This is the year to start what you've been planning. The energy supports bold, self-directed action.
1.business_focus: Launch new ventures, establish new brand directions, make independent decisions. The energy favors originality and self-reliance.
1.watch_for: Impatience with slow results. Year 1 plants seeds — harvest comes later. Don't abandon too early.
1.power_move: Start the thing you've been researching.

2.energy: Cooperation, patience, diplomacy. This year supports building relationships, not forcing outcomes. Slow down and collaborate.
2.business_focus: Form partnerships, nurture key relationships, develop teamwork. Behind-the-scenes preparation. Joint ventures and collaborations favored.
2.watch_for: Frustration with pace. Year 2 requires patience that feels unproductive. Trust the process.
2.power_move: Invest in the relationship that will define your next chapter.

3.energy: Creativity, communication, visibility. Your ideas want to be expressed. Social energy is high. Creative projects flourish.
3.business_focus: Content creation, marketing, brand building, public speaking, social media growth. Express your vision loudly.
3.watch_for: Scattered creative energy. So many ideas, so little focus. Channel expression into one primary vehicle.
3.power_move: Put yourself in front of your audience consistently.

4.energy: Structure, discipline, hard work. Time to build the infrastructure that supports everything else. Not glamorous, but essential.
4.business_focus: Systems building, process documentation, financial organization, operational improvement. Build the machine.
4.watch_for: Feeling stuck or limited. Year 4 feels like walls are closing in. They're actually becoming a foundation.
4.power_move: Build the system you wish you had last year.

5.energy: Freedom, change, unexpected shifts. This year shakes things up. Adaptability is your greatest asset. Expect the unexpected.
5.business_focus: Pivoting, exploring new markets, travel, networking outside your usual circles. Break out of routine.
5.watch_for: Impulsive decisions. Change energy can feel like freedom but lead to chaos. Choose your changes deliberately.
5.power_move: Make the change you've been avoiding.

6.energy: Service, family, community, responsibility. This year asks you to step up for others. Business growth through deepening existing relationships.
6.business_focus: Customer experience improvement, team development, community building, service refinement. Deepen, don't expand.
6.watch_for: Over-giving. The pull to sacrifice for others is strong. Maintain boundaries or burn out.
6.power_move: Invest in your team and your best customers.

7.energy: Reflection, analysis, inner work. This year favors research, study, and strategic planning over aggressive action. Quality over quantity.
7.business_focus: Research and development, skill building, strategic planning, intellectual property creation. Go deep, not wide.
7.watch_for: Withdrawal from business. The pull toward solitude is strong. Stay connected to your market even while studying.
7.power_move: Create the intellectual property that becomes your moat.

8.energy: Achievement, financial gain, authority. This is the harvest year — reap what you've sown. Financial matters are front and center.
8.business_focus: Revenue scaling, investment, negotiation, power positioning. Make the big financial moves. Authority and recognition are available.
8.watch_for: Overreach. Power energy can become greed. Stay ethical and sustainable.
8.power_move: Make the financial decision you've been postponing.

9.energy: Endings, release, culmination. This year closes a 9-year cycle. Let go of what no longer serves. Clear space for the new cycle beginning next year.
9.business_focus: Closing projects, releasing underperforming ventures, forgiveness, giving back. Tie up loose ends. Prepare for renewal.
9.watch_for: Holding on. The urge to cling to what's ending is strong. Release creates space for Year 1's fresh start.
9.power_move: Kill the project or relationship that you know is done.

personal_month_business.1: Initiative month. Start something new. Make decisions independently. Best for launches and announcements.
personal_month_business.2: Partnership month. Collaborate, listen, negotiate. Best for relationship building and deal-making.
personal_month_business.3: Expression month. Create content, network, socialize. Best for marketing and brand visibility.
personal_month_business.4: Building month. Focus on operations, systems, organization. Best for infrastructure work.
personal_month_business.5: Change month. Adapt, pivot, experiment. Best for trying new approaches and breaking patterns.
personal_month_business.6: Service month. Focus on team, customers, community. Best for deepening loyalty and improving quality.
personal_month_business.7: Strategy month. Research, plan, reflect. Best for R&D and strategic decision-making.
personal_month_business.8: Power month. Push for results, negotiate hard, focus on revenue. Best for financial action.
personal_month_business.9: Completion month. Wrap up projects, release what's done, prepare for next cycle. Best for clearing the deck.
